history.content: I've seen this question before...It falls right into the area where we're missing an advisor. Your suggestion about having a co-advisor to sponsor your research with your advisor at LBNL seems very reasonable to me. I will respond to you and Gina on e-mail.

I was accepted into the EECS Honors Program this summer, and I want to complete an honors thesis. I currently do computational neuroscience research with a Bioscience professor in LBNL. The honors thesis requirements state that the advisor must be in the EE or CS departments. I was wondering if I would still be able to complete an honors thesis with my professor as my advisor. I feel as this would be the best option for me, as my breadth focus for the honors program is Neuroscience/Neuroengineering. If not, is it possible to have a co-advisor in the EECS department while still working with my current professor?
history.subject: EECS Honors Thesis Advisor
